using puff pastry for the dough instead
of making strudel dough which is

pounds of the apples you can use gala or
Fuji which is an unusual Apple to bake
with but they hold their shape really
really nicely cut your apples into thin

them so they don't just color there's no
lemon juice in here to keep them from
discoloring and these apples are gonna
be pre cooked so that everything comes
together really quickly so I'm gonna
saute these cook your apples stirring
around every once in a while until they
soften and break down just a little bit
but don't lose their shape about 15
minutes when the apples have cooked down
you need to cool them down so what I
like to do is put them on a baking sheet
spread them out as thinly as possible
let them cool a little bit first and
then you can put them in the
refrigerator this needs to cool
completely so you could do this a day or
two in advance if you wanted to just
once it was cool transfer it to a
container that's airtight so it doesn't

then you can shape and form and bake
your strudel
leave one inch on either side and then
